p: The DBR (23°10′N, 112°35′E) has a monsoon climate and is located in a subtropical, moist forest life zone. The annual mean temperature is 22.3°C and the annual mean rainfall is 1678 mm with a distinct seasonal pattern. Monthly average air temperature and precipitation, representing DBR's climatic regime, were obtained from the Gaoyao weather station [ 34]. The reserve is dominated by regional climax, evergreen broadleaf forest represented by the Cryptocarya community, which is dominated by Cryptocarya chinensis, Cryptocarya concinna and Castanopsis chinensis. Abundance of the 3 dominant species in two communities was investigated 9 times from 1955 to 1985. One community was Cryptocarya community, which was at the relatively stable stage; the other community was Pinus-Castanopsis-Schima community, which was at a relatively early stage of succession. There were very few human activities in the study area until 1980s and there was no big pest outbreak before 1985[ 35]. More than twelve 10×10 m 2 quadrates were investigated in each of the communities. The average abundance (number of individuals) of 3 species in 2 communities for every investigation was recorded [ 36] ( S1 Table). The climate data for monthly temperature and precipitation in DBR were provided by Guoyi Zhou (2012, pers. comm., 5 September).
